gov.usgs.utility

Class FTPUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.utility.FTPUtility
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class FTPUtility
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    This class is a helper class to use Apache Commons FTP

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FTPUtility() 
      FTPUtility(java.lang.String hostName, java.lang.String loginName)
      Create FTPUtility that logs in anonymously to host Note: connections are passive and binary by default.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FTPUtility

        public FTPUtility()

      • FTPUtility

        public FTPUtility(java.lang.String hostName,
                  java.lang.String loginName)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Create FTPUtility that logs in anonymously to host Note: connections are passive and binary by default.
        Parameters:
        hostName - Name of host to connect to.
        loginName - Password used for anonymous connection, usually an email address.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If one occurs

    • Method Detail

      • getModificationDate

        public java.lang.String getModificationDate(java.lang.String dirName,
                                            java.lang.String fileName)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Get the modification date as a String of the file on the Server. Must have used the FTPUtility(host,login) constructor so you are logged in.
        Parameters:
        dirName - Name of the Directory where the file is on Server.
        fileName - Name of the file on the server.
        Returns:
        String representing time in format "YYYYMMDDhhmmss(.xxx)?"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if one occurs

      • getFileBytes

        public byte[] getFileBytes(java.lang.String dirName,
                           java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve a binary file from an FTP server anonymously Must have started with FTPUtility creator that already logs in.
        Parameters:
        dirName - Name of the directory where the file is on the server.
        fileName - Name of the file on the server.
        Returns:
        The bytes from the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Any error will result in an IOException.

      • getFileBytes

        public byte[] getFileBytes(java.lang.String dirName,
                           java.lang.String fileName,
                           java.lang.String hostName,
                           java.lang.String loginName)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve a binary file from an FTP server anonymously
        Parameters:
        dirName - Name of the directory where the file is on the server.
        fileName - Name of the file on the server.
        hostName - Hostname of the server connecting to.
        loginName - This will be the password for the anonymous login. Usually just an email address.
        Returns:
        The bytes from the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Any error will result in an IOException.
